qas.question: What was the Interwar period marked by?

answers.text: radical change in the international order

qas.question: What institution was meant to bring stability?
When was The League of Nations created?
Who undermined  The League Of Nations?

answers.text: bellicosity of Nazi Germany, Imperial Japan, the Soviet Union, and Mussolini's Italy, and by the non-participation of the United States

qas.question: What effect did the  undermining of The league of Nations have on the people?

answers.text: leading many to question its effectiveness and legitimacy.

context: The interwar period was also marked by a <a0_0>radical change in the international order<a0_0/>, away from the balance of power that had dominated pre–World War I Europe. One main institution that was meant to bring stability was <a1_0>the League of Nations<a1_0/>, which was created <a2_0>after the First World War<a2_0/> with the intention of maintaining world security and peace and encouraging economic growth between member countries. The League was undermined by the <a3_0>bellicosity of Nazi Germany, Imperial Japan, the Soviet Union, and Mussolini's Italy, and by the non-participation of the United States<a3_0/>, <a4_0>leading many to question its effectiveness and legitimacy.
